snippet: In other referendum votes, Colorado and Washington  legalized marijuana for recreational use.
abstract: California voters endorse Gov Jerry Brown's ballot initiative calling for $6 billion tax increase by 54 percent to 46 percent, confounding pollsters who had been predicting closer outcome or defeat; Brown presented tax increase as only way to save California's underfinanced public schools.

byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: In other referendum votes, Colorado and Washington  legalized marijuana for recreational use.

headline.seo: In California, Voters Approve Ballot Measure That Raises TaxesIn California, Approve Voters Ballot Measure That Raises Taxes
headline.main: Californians Back Taxes to Avoid Education Cuts
headline.print_headline: Californians Endorse a Tax Initiative to Avoid Education Cuts
